title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants, with changes including raising the grant amount to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants to $500 in paragraph (5) and $4,331,000,000 for the academic year 2007-2008. The Federal Pell Grant amount will be increased by $1,050 for award year 2007-2008, effective July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for the taxable year is now $3,750, with an increase in the phaseout to $75,000 ($150,000). Conforming amendments have been made to the Internal Revenue Code. The Internal Revenue Code has been amended to increase the deduction for education loan interest to $3,750, with a phaseout starting at $75,000 and ending at $150,000 for taxable years after 2007. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The sunset provision in the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. Repeal of EGTRRA Sunset for modifications to education individual retirement accounts. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for employer-provided educational assistance under section 411 of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001.
